Name: Gotland 1
Remarks: World's first commercial HVDC link. Expanded by ABB in 1970, decommissioned in 1986

Name: Konti-Skan 1
Remarks: Replaced in August 2006 by modern converters using thyristors

Name: SACOI 1
Remarks: Replaced in 1986 by Thyr, multiterminal scheme. The line reused by SACOI 2, see below.

Name: Kingsnorth
Remarks: Bipolar scheme Supplier: English Electric Shut down in 1987

Name: Skagerrak 1 + 2
Remarks: Supplier: STK(Nexans) Control system upgrade by ABB in 2007

Name: Tjæreborg
Remarks: Interconnection to wind power generating stations

Name: HVDC Troll
Remarks: Power supply for offshore gas compressor Supplier: ABB

Name: Cometa
Remarks: Expected completion 2011 Supplier: Siemens (converter stations); Prysmian/Nexans (cables)

Name: SAPEI
Remarks: The largest HVDC link in the Mediterranean Sea. Supplier: ABB

Name: INELFE
Remarks: Supplier: Siemens, Cables: Prysmian. €700m, 8 km tunnel near HSR

Name: Western HVDC Link
Remarks: Supplier: Prysmian Group, Siemens First subsea 600kV link

Name: North Sea Link
Remarks: Supplier: ABB, Prysmian Group, Nexans, MACH 3 Control & Protection
